did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Manuscripts, correspondence, articles, clippings, and photographs.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Manuscripts, correspondence, printed newspaper articles, clippings, and photographs by, to, or about Nathan, documenting his career as theater critic, author, and editor of the literary newspaper The American Spectator. Includes manuscripts for books and articles by Nathan; extensive correspondence concerning dealings with publishers, authors, and producers; letters from readers and fellow writers commenting on Nathan's work, including letters on the American Mercury and the American Spectator; and manuscripts of plays by other writers, including 18 plays by William Saroyan and 10 by Sean O'Casey. Also included are manuscripts and galley proofs for Nathan's annual Theatre Book of the Year (9 vols., 1942-1951).

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: American theater critic, author, and editor. He edited the magazine Smart Set with H.L. Mencken from 1914-1923, founded and co-edited the magazine American Mercury with Mencken, and was one of the founding editors of the literary newspaper American Spectator.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Manuscripts, correspondence, printed newspaper articles, clippings, and photographs by, to, or about Nathan, documenting his career as theater critic, author, and editor of the literary newspaper The American Spectator. Includes manuscripts for books and articles by Nathan; extensive correspondence concerning dealings with publishers, authors, and producers; letters from readers and fellow writers commenting on Nathan's work, including letters on the American Mercury and the American Spectator; and manuscripts of plays by other writers, including 18 plays by William Saroyan and 10 by Sean O'Casey. Also included are manuscripts and galley proofs for Nathan's annual Theatre Book of the Year (9 vols., 1942-1951).

Also included are hundreds of letters from H.L. Mencken, ranging in date from 1925-1955; 129 letters from Eugene O'Neill, dating from 1919-1949; and 58 letters from William Saroyan, ranging from 1928-1957. Other correspondents include Sherwood Anderson, James Branch Cabell, Gordon Craig, Theodore Dreiser, the Encyclopaedia Britannica, St. John Greer Ervine; Alfred A. Knopf, Inc.; Sinclair Lewis, Carlotta O'Neill, Carl Sandburg, and Jim Tully. Also included are many photographs of Nathan and several of H.L. Mencken, Eugene O'Neill, Sean O'Casey, Lillian Gish, and others.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.persname: Ervine, St. John G.(St. John Greer), b. 1883.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: George Jean Nathan collection, #4615. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Large book collection also held in the repository, including many works by Nathan and works of other writers in copies inscribed to Nathan.
Related material in the Theodore Dreiser Collection, Department of Rare Books, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: photographs; letters by Nathan; clippings; printed articles; manuscripts; Theatre Book manuscripts; letters to Nathan.
Letters by Nathan arranged in chronological order; manuscripts, alphabetically by title; Theatre Book manuscripts, in chronological order; letters to Nathan, alphabetically by correspondent.
